commitResults.messageTitle: Add skeletal version of Project Portfolio Page (PPP)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently there is no PPP.

PPP is needed as a well-documented data point for our SE
experience and for evaluators to use for evaluation.

Add aaronjt1.md in docs/team folder

It is done as such so that github will display relevant page
Completing milestone v1.1 individual tasks

Currently, the AboutUs.md is default template given to us.

We need to change it to fit our team.

Add roles and responsibilities for each member.
Update AboutUs.md

Currently,there are no headers for the structure of the User Guide.

The headers like introduction, quick start, FAQ, known-issues, etc are
needed to guide users in using the User Guide.

Add introduction, quick start, FAQ, known-issues and command summary
headers.
Update UserGuide.md

commitResults.messageTitle: Update DeveloperGuide.md to include new content
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the "Appendix:Requirements" section is default

To contextualise the Developer Guide to our project, we updated that
portion with the content we currently have.

Update Product Scope, User Stories, Use Cases, NFR and Glossary.
Add AboutUs image and PPP
Update UserGuide.md
Update README.md to suit our application
Update User Guide: Viewing Help and Adding a Patient

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix table of content link for UserGuide.md

commitResults.messageBody:
Renamed the Person class to Patient

Current, the class is named Person, but in our project, the person we are interested in is Patient.

Rename Person class to Patient class
Rename all instances of Person to Patient
Update model component to rename all Person instance to Patient
Update storage component to rename all Person instance to Patient
Update Ui component to rename all Person instance to Patient
Update test names for all instances of Person to Patient

Currently, there is no function to get all the prefixes that are present
in the user input.

There is a need to get the prefixes present so as to create the Patient
object with relevant fields.

Add getPrefixesPresent function which takes in argMultimap and return
list of prefixes present.

Currently, the logic of creating patients from field values is done in
parse function

To maintain SLAP, i have abstracted that logic into a new function

Create createPatientFromPrefixes function to create patient from prefix
fields

commitResults.messageTitle: Create test case for CreatePatientFromPrefixes function
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently there is no test cases for the function createPatientFromPrefixes

Test cases is essential to ensure that this function work as expected

Create 2 test case functions,
createPatientFromPrefixes_nameFieldPresent_correctPatientCreated and createPatientFromPrefixes_allFieldsPresent_correctPatientCreated

Currently, if a user does not type in the required field,
it will just display the whole command format

It is important to explicitly tell the user which required commands are
missing

Create new message MESSAGE_REQUIRED_COMMAND_NOT_FOUND which will be
output when user missed out the required field
Add Age and Gender Attributes
Update Add Command to allow required and optional fields
Add Department Enum and AssignedDepartment Class
Add Birthday and IC Attributes
Edit Patient and CliSyntax classes to include new attributes

Currently, Patient class is taking in Department and Record as input

Department and Record are to be created when Patient is created, thus it
shouldnt be an input

Update Patient constructor to remove AssignedDepartment and Record
parameters, also initialiazed them with default values

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Record.java to initialise with default values
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the instantiation of Record class does not initialise default
values for other fields.

This means that if a particular program wants to get its attribute
value, it could lead to null value.

Update Record.java to include 3 default initialization values for its
fields

commitResults.messageTitle: Update PatientBuilder.java to cater to new Patient class
Update each Patient attribute to have default value
Update AddCommandParser.java to use new Patient class
Update SampleDataUtil.java to use new Patient class
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the sample patients are using outdated fields.

It is important to update the patients to use the new fields.

Add the Gender, IcNumber and Birthday fields to sample Patients

commitResults.messageTitle: Update JsonAdaptedPatient.java to use new Patient class
Update JsonAdaptedPatientTest.java to include new Patient attributes
Update patient attributes to have more intuitive default values

commitResults.messageBody: Update EditCommand.java, EditCommandParser.java, and ParserUtil.java
Add Assigned Department to storage
Update the GUI of our application

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow display of assignedDepartment field in UI
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the storage is able to store assignedDepartment field and
value, but it cannot be displayed on UI

It is important to display all the fields in the UI

Update JsonAdaptedPatient to read the JSON field of assignedDepartment

Create a new constructor for Patient class that will allow
assignedDepartment to be a parameter.
Integrate assignedDepartment display

commitResults.messageTitle: Update CommandTestUtil.java and EditPatientDescriptorBuilder.java to fit new Patient attributes
Fix AddCommandParserTest.java testcases to accommodate new Patient attributes

commitResults.messageBody: Update testing utilities with new Patient attributes

Currently, there is no predicate to test for patients with a certain Ic
number

It is important to create a predicate for that scenario so that the
filtered list could find the patient with the ic number

Add PatientWithNumberPredicate.java and
PatientWithNumberPredicateTest.java

Currently, there is no exception which handles a patient with a certain
field not being found

It is important to catch this improper user input as an exception so as
to handle it well, in this case, to output a message to warn user.

Create PatientWithFieldNotFoundException.java together with
ViewCommand.java and ViewCommandTest.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Create ViewCommandParser.java and integrate it to program
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there is ViewCommand.java, however no parser object
to create that Command object

It is important to maintain the abstraction between command and parser

Create ViewCommandParser.java to parse user input and create ViewCommand
object

commitResults.messageTitle: Create ViewCommandParserTest.java and fix checkstyles issues
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there is ViewCommandParser.java but no test cases for it

Test case is needed to ensure the workability of the parser.

Create ViewCommandParserTest.java and fix the relevant checkstyles
issues

Currently, the github CI/CD is failing due to checkstyle issues not
found by gradle checkstyle test

It is important to ensure the checkstyle is met

Fix checkstyle issues around the code base

commitResults.messageTitle: Update DeveloperGuide.md to include View patient feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the developer guide does not contain the implementation
philosophy of the view patient feature

It is important to constantly update the developer guide of new features
to prevent excessive workload towards end of milestone

Update DeveloperGuide.md to include View patient feature

commitResults.messageTitle: Add logging and assertions to the View and Add patient features
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there are no logging mechanism to track code events and
no assertions to ensure assumptions are true.

Logging is important to allow for ease of debugging and tracking of
users actions, assertion on other hand help reduce developer bugs

Add logging and assertions to the View and Add patient features

Currently, the test case on toString method is failing

It is important to ensure that unit testing like on the toString
method is successful

Fix PatientTest.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Update UserGuide.md to improve documentation on add and view feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the add and view features in the userguide are outdated.

It is important to continously update the user guide with new changes
so that users can be informed of changes.

Update UserGuide.md to improve documentation on add and view feature
Create view command
Modify Delete Command to use IC Number

Not all team members have uploaded their AboutUs.md
images and PPP documents.

Each member should upload their respective documents.

Let's add the AboutUs.md image and PPP for wujy28.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update README.md to suit our application
commitResults.messageBody:
The current README is outdated and written for Addressbook Level 3.

Now that we are using this code base for A&E, we should have the
README reflect this as well.

Let's update the README to be about our application, A&E, instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update User Guide: Viewing Help and Adding a Patient
commitResults.messageBody:
The current User Guide is outdated and still reflects the
features of AB3.

Since we are now using the codebase to develop A&E, we
must update our user guide as such.

Let's
* Update the Viewing Help screenshot to that of A&E's Ui
* Modify the Adding a Person section to Adding a Patient

commitResults.messageTitle: Update User Guide: Update Table of Contents
commitResults.messageBody:
The current Table of Contents lacks the newly added
section on adding a patient.

Let's add that section to the Table of Contents.

There are currently some formatting bugs in
documentation like the README, AboutUs, DG, UG and index.
Bugs include invalid hyperlinks, random symbols, inconsistent
headings and grammatical errors.

Fixing these issues can help our documentation come across
as more professional and proper.

Let's
* Fix grammatical issues
* Standardize heading capitalization
* Contextual important parts of the docs to our project
* Fix hyperlink errors

The existing pointers about command under Features
are outdated and contradict other parts of our UG.
The list patients command is in a different format
from the list command of AB3 as well.

Updating the pointers can help our UG be more
consistent. Moreover, changing the list patients
command format from list patients to list can
help us cut down on work from having to change
the user input for that command.

Let's update the features and list command format
in the user guide.

The Patient class does not currently store information
regarding the department the patient is assigned to.

Adding an attribute that stores that information can
help us create the starting ground to implement the
functionality of assigning patients to departments.

Let's,
* Create the AssignedDepartment class, which is a
  Patient attribute
* Create the Department Enumeration, which represents
  the departments in the hospital

Using an enumeration to represent the departments will
allow us to constrain the department information to a
limited predefined set of values. This implementation
might however be changed in the future should the need
arises (i.e. if we want the user to be able to customize
the available departments, or add more functionality to
the department type).

Currently, no testing is done for the newly added
AssignedDepartment and Department classes.

We should test these classes to discover bugs and
fix them so that we can ensure that they work
properly.

Let's add the test classes AssignedDepartmentTest
and DepartmentTest to test these classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle issues in Main and Test
commitResults.messageBody:
There are currently some coding standard issues in
some of the newly added classes.

We should fix them to ensure code quality.

Let's fix these issues.

This merge is to update the branch as the master branch
has changed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix whitespace issue in Gender class
Improve testing in AssignedDepartment and Department
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously the testing for AssignedDepartment and Department
did not cover enough cases.

Improving test coverage can help us detect more bugs and
ensure that our code is more robust.

Let's add a few more test cases for isValidDepartment and
findDepartment.
Minor modifications to IcNumber and IcNumberTest

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle issues in some classes

commitResults.messageBody: Branch update patient fields

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix inconsistencies in EditCommand and EditCommandParser
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the EditCommand and EditCommandParser classes are
inconsistent in that they contain methods that process
patient attributes that are not parameters into the Edit
command, or certain parts lack the processing of important
attributes.

Fixing this issue will prevent further bugs and lead to
neater code.

Let's,
* Add and remove attributes in the two classes for
consistency
* Make sure that important attributes are mentioned in
parts that were previously lacking them

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix StackOverflow bug involving PatientBuilder and RecordBuilder
commitResults.messageBody:
There is an issue where after PatientBuilder() is called,
it will call RecordBuilder(), which in turn calls
PatientBuilder() again, causing a StackOverflow error.

We need to fix this to get our test cases to pass.

Let's
* Add a new constructor to RecordBuilder that takes in
a PatientBuilder to initialize its patient, instead
of calling PatientBuilder again
* Add new attributes to TypicalPatients

Note that not all of the fields in Typical Patients are
updated! AMY and BOB still need to be updated, which
involves adding new attributes into CommandTestUtilgit add --all

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new attributes to some console messages
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing console messages do not display the
new attributes, confusing the user as to what
attributes are available.

Adding them to the messages allow them to view
all the patient's attributes even without the
updated GUI.

Let's update the Add command and patient messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak layout of GUI to resemble our ui design
commitResults.messageBody:
The GUI currently only displays the patient list in
the entire window.

We need to update the layout of the GUI so that it
more closely resembles the final product.

Let's change the layout of the main window to be more
similar to our proposed UI design. Let's also add
the new attributes to each patient so that the user
can refer to them when they scan the list.

Note that this layout is still tentative and subject
to change.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add record panel and function to display selected patient
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing layout has a blank space on the right as the
record has yet to be implemented in the GUI.

We should allow the user to view the details in the record
easily via the GUI.

Let's,
* Create .fxml file for the record panel and record card
* Create the controllers for these files
* Create the funcitonality of allowing users to view the
selected patient's record (via the GUI)

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve the styling of the GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
The current GUI does not look consistent, and has
weird spacing in some places.

Fixing these issues can allow our GUI to look more
professional.

Let's style the GUI such that it looks more
consistent.

Note that this will not be the final theme/design of
our GUI.

Add Age and Gender Attributes with Testing to Patient

There is important information, such as the age and gender, of patients
that should be known to users. Such information is missing in the code.

Adding the age and gender attributes ensures that we have important
details of patients.

Let’s create the classes: Age, Gender, AgeTest and GenderTest. Doing so
will ensure that the user can input important information about patients
into the application and ease subsequent testing of the information.
Minor fix
Improve Testing for Department Attribute and Fix CheckStyle Issues

commitResults.messageBody:

New attributes have been created for our Patient class. However, the
other classes are not implementing the said attributes.

Editing the Patient and CliSyntax will allow us to take the first step in
implementing the new attributes.

Let’s edit the code of the Patient and CliSyntax classes. Doing so will
allow smoother and more consistent editing of other classes done by
other members.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix compilation errors in overall app

Modify Delete Command to use IC Number
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing delete command uses the index to delete a patient from the list. This can be very cumbersome especially in very large datasets of patients.

Hence, use IC Number of the patient instead to delete a patient directly from the list like "delete T1234567B"

Let's update the Delete Command and fix tests for the DeleteCommand and Parser tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Edit Command to use IC Number
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing edit command uses the index to edit a patient's description in the list. This can be very cumbersome especially in very large datasets of patients.

Hence, use IC Number of the patient instead to edit a patient's description directly from the list like "edit T1234567B n/NEW NAME"

Let's update the EDIT Command and fix tests for the EditCommand and Parser tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Edit and Delete Command to use IC Number
commitResults.messageBody: Making changes to add prefix i/ in front of the IC Numbers for these commands to standardize the command format as per the User Guide

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Delete Command Parser to use IC Number
commitResults.messageBody: Making changes to add prefix i/ in front of the IC Numbers for these commands to standardize the command format as per the User Guide for the Delete Command
